column4: Restarting X is where I run into problems.  I really have no clue what X is for sure, but when I ctrl-alt-bkspace the screen goes black.  Then I ctrl-alt-f1 and I get a prompt.  I type startx and I recieve an error...
I don't remember specifically.  It seemed to be telling me X was already running or something?...
ctr-alt-backspace should kill X. It should restart with a nvidia logo afrer being killed.
ctrl-alt-f1, login as your usual user and sudo less /var/log/Xorg.0.log says. Look for lines beginning with EE (which denote errors)
